name: Zakir Khan
bio: He borned in 1970 in Rajshahi.He is from an educated family.He has 5 siblings and among them he is the youngest.Currently he living in dhanmondi,Dhaka with his wife and 2 children.

recipes.cookingMethod: Peel and clean the prawns, and boil them in salted water for 5-6 minutes. Drain and set aside.Chop the onion, green chili, and garlic cloves finely.Heat mustard oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion, green chili, and garlic until they turn golden brown.Add the boiled prawns, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to the pan, and mix everything together.Remove from heat and add the chopped coriander leaves.Mash everything together using a mortar and pestle, until you get a smooth paste.Serve the chingri bhorta with steamed rice or paratha.

Clean and cut the ilish fish into pieces. Marinate the fish pieces with salt, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.Thinly slice the onion and green chilies.In a separate bowl, mix together the ginger paste, garlic paste, mustard oil, and coconut milk.Add the marinated fish pieces, sliced onion, and green chilies to the bowl, and mix everything together.Place the mixture in a baking dish, cover with foil, and steam for 15-20 minutes.Serve hot with steamed rice.

Cut all the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.Dry roast the mustard seeds, poppy seeds, and cumin seeds, and grind them into a fine paste.Heat mustard oil in a pan, and sauté the vegetables until they are half-cooked.Add the ground spice paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sugar, and salt to the pan, and mix everything together.Add enough water to cover the vegetables, and let it simmer on low heat for 10-15 minutes, until the vegetables are fully cooked and then serve it with salad.
